programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: After months of tireless effort, Rick, Marty and the team begin the massive excavation at Smith's Cove and almost immediately strike gold.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick sends his staff to a famous street market, and expects them to come back with something special. A client brings a rare 1930s telephone box into the workshop.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team restores an antique apple vending machine and a 1920s floor sander.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is excited when a 1950s toy car is brought into the shop, while Ron, Tyler and Brettly hunt for bargains.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick examines a 1920s chainsaw and an unusual golf ball dispenser.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank visit the editor of Motorcycle magazine, who has decided to put some of his collection of rare bikes up for sale.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: R&R Conner Aviation is forced to choose between safety and production, while Jimmy Smith continues to battle with a gigantic log known as Moby Dick.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Times become tougher for the loggers, as Rygaard's rookie tries to keep his job and one of R&R's pilots is left stranded when a sudden fog arrives.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Brettly returns from his first solo picking trip with an impressive haul, and Rick asks a former client to help him work out how a 1930s iron lung works.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores an antique towel steamer from a 19th-century barbershop and a 1950s television.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: A look at the 1974 Coyame and 2007 Xilitla UFO crash cases in Mexico, where the Mexican and US military reportedly recovered wreckage material.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The January 2008 mass UFO sightings between Fort Worth, Texas and Houston, with focus on the nearby town of Stephenville, Texas.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: Blow Out.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: Examining the mega-tornado which tore a path of destruction through Oklahoma City in May 1999, and questioning what would happen if similar winds were to strike Dallas.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: A dangerous storm rolls in, forcing the crews to choose between risking their lives or abandoning a lucrative catch. One captain is determined to prove himself to his daughter.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: Last season's champion struggles to stay in the lead, while rival crews face circumstances beyond their control and an unlikely challenger enjoys an unprecedented success.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: Fishing boats from other areas join the hunt for tuna as the season draws to an end, and the local captains are forced to defend their turf as the sea becomes overcrowded.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: A narrow margin separates the top four boats in the last two weeks of the season. TJ Ott makes a risky trip to Georges Bank and a bad week jeopardises Dave Carraro's winning streak.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The four leading captains hope to make one last big haul in a final week where every fish makes a difference. Tyler McLaughlin tries to get back in the game.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi goes to the auction alone, while Darrell buys some vintage bottles.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod prepare to reopen the store as the buyers head for a round of auctions in Hollywood.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Don't Bid So Close to Me
programme.desc: Barry finds an item with a connection to a rock legend at an auction in Rancho Cucamonga, while Brandi and Jarrod examine a vintage mask.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers take a long journey into the desert of Lancaster, California, and Nabila Haniss is richly rewarded for making the trek.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry makes a surprising bid for a locker containing an old mattress, believing its appearance belies its true value.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell bets everything on the unknown contents of a locker in Harbor City.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders go to Santa Cruz for one of the most hotly anticipated auctions of the year.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi discover a secret in San Francisco, while Darrell takes a gamble that could cost him everything.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell gambles by bidding on a unit full of construction equipment, while Barry brings a secret weapon to the auction.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell hopes that his instincts will put him back in profit, while Dave has trouble finding anything worth bidding for.

programme.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan's American Hustle
programme.desc: Ronnie's relative obscurity among the Chicago locals might be the perfect set-up for a hustle, but not everything goes to plan for him and Matt Smith.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: New evidence uncovered at Smith's Cove brings the fellowship closer to deciphering the purpose of the mysterious U-shaped structure. Plus, a previously undiscovered formation seems likely to lead to the island's legendary flood tunnels.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Rick and Marty Lagina make a discovery at Smith's Cove that promises to help them solve the mystery of the Money Pit.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: Ten men plunge into the wilderness with only a backpack, where they are forced to hunt, fend off predators and endure extreme isolation.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Marcus Brigstocke, Gary Delaney and Zoe Lyons join host Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for another round of the satirical news quiz from July 2012.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Guests Fern Britton, Stephen Mangan, Ken Livingstone and Reginald D Hunter join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon presents.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Not Going Out star and Would I Lie to You? team captain Lee Mack takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with broadcaster Janet Street-Porter and comedian Sara Pascoe joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines in April 2018.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy arranges a special surprise for Lee's birthday, which sees their family and friends joining them in a Crystal Maze-style physical adventure game where the objective is to escape from a series of rooms. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian introduces popcorn to Munty, Barbara dreams of becoming one of the famous Munty Clack Dancers and Howell makes a truth potion for Slasher Morgan - with disastrous results.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Herman gives The Jug And The Other Jug a relaunch. Meanwhile, the deadly disease Woodpox is sweeping through Munty, and only Howell has the cure.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Matt LeBlanc test drives the new Aston Martin V8 Vantage, while Rory Reid puts the Rolls-Royce Phantom through its paces to see if it lives up to its reputation as the best car in the world, and Chris Harris makes the case that a Ford Fiesta is better than a Lamborghini. With guest Stephen Mangan.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of kayakers head to the Himalayas to visit the last great unexplored river in Bhutan. Legend has it that at some point, the river drops off the face of the planet.

programme.title: Mega Air
programme.desc: The world's biggest air package handling facility at UPS Worldport, which sorts two million items per night for worldwide delivery. Fireman also tackle a mock air freighter inferno.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of the Nottinghamshire Police force through officers' body-worn cameras.

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: The former wrestler challenges eight contestants to triumph over a series of gruelling physical endurance tests.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.desc: Journeys taken by the biggest cargo in Britain. Some of Scotland's finest whiskey must make a 180-mile road trip in order to end up on the supermarket shelves.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank look back on their trickiest excavations ever, including relics buried underground and awesome finds trapped under mountains of junk.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.sub-title: Have Yourself a Merry Pickers Christmas
programme.desc: Mike tries to put Frank in a Christmas mood with two trips in search of precious objects.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Guests Fern Britton, Stephen Mangan, Ken Livingstone and Reginald D Hunter join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon presents.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Jimmy Carr and Marcus Brigstocke, TV presenter Terry Christian and singer Jamelia join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Jack Whitehall and Frankie Boyle, TV presenter Christine Bleakley and journalist Kelvin MacKenzie join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Strongman Eddie meets - and eats - gators roaming the Everglades, tests his grappling skills with WWE legends The Headbangers, and tries to devour a kitchen sink full of ice-cream.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie visits the Garden State for supersized breakfast in a New Jersey diner, a tryout with ice hockey pros the NJ Devils - and an epic struggle with an eight-hot-dog challenge.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A man calls 999 claiming his car has been stolen, but when the vehicle turns up crashed into a wall with cans of cider in the footwell, James is suspicious to say the least.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition of the comedy quiz, with actress and TV and radio presenter Liza Tarbuck, comedienne Susan Calman and broadcaster Sandi Toksvig joining regular panellist Alan Davies. Host Stephen Fry asks a range of questions on a kaleidoscope of topics beginning with 'k', with points being awarded for interesting answers as well as correct ones.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Not Going Out star and Would I Lie to You? team captain Lee Mack takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with broadcaster Janet Street-Porter and comedian Sara Pascoe joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines in April 2018.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Comedy quiz show from 2014. Host Dara O Briain asks panellists to take an irreverent look at world events, with the Fifa World Cup in Brazil, the Commonwealth Games in Glasgow and that year's referendum on Scottish independence all possible targets for satirical comment. Regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by comedians Ed Byrne, Milton Jones, Romesh Ranganathan and Katherine Ryan for a series of stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies hosts more surreal celebrity challenges, as Lolly Adefope tries long distance painting, and Hugh Dennis is befuddled by an egg.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedian Josh Widdicombe, choirboy-turned-presenter Aled Jones and DJ Sara Cox join Frank Skinner for the comedy panel show, competing to have their pet hates banished to the infamous room. Their gripes include Lord of the Rings, fish bones and death metal.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Meeting the Welsh Highland Railway's oldest volunteer fireman, 80-year-old Cedric Lodge, who has worked on the railways for 60 years. In Devon, there is a look at the Autotrain.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at the sinister history of Edinburgh's vaults and the development of Helsinki's subterranean spaces. Plus, the impact of the building of Naples on the volcanic ground below.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part one of two. The French general's 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt, providing a base from which to attack English territory in the Indies.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part two of two. How the 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt was ultimately defeated, but secured a lasting legacy by marking the birth of Egyptology.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Channel Islands at War
programme.desc: John Nettles discovers more about the desperate last year of the Second World War on the islands and the locals' reliance on Red Cross parcels.

programme.title: Find My Past
programme.desc: Veterans and relatives of those involved in the 1940 Dunkirk evacuation remember the role played by six cockle boats from Essex. Presented by Chris Hollins.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Hitler's launch of his great counter-offensive against the unsuspecting Allies in the Ardennes. This was the Nazis' last gamble in the West to turn the tide of the war.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: The Allies reached the last great natural barrier between their forces and the German heartland. If they could get across the River Rhine, the war would be won.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: The use of propaganda in Hitler's Nazi regime. The first episode examines the Fuehrer's fascination with propaganda, which began in the trenches of the First World War.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: The decade of propaganda, impassioned speeches, newspaper articles, posters and campaigning that all led to one moment - Hitler being made Chancellor of Germany in January 1933.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: As Hitler's ambitions spread beyond Germany, the world drew toward another great war. This one would be fought on many battlefields, but also for the hearts and minds of the people.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.sub-title: The Brides In The Bath Killer
programme.desc: The case of George Smith, who married a succession of women and murdered them so he could inherit their wealth.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day explores the case of Edith Thompson, who conspired with her lover to murder her husband in 1922 - a story that inspired Alfred Hitchcock.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: A serial killer who terrorised London in 1942, using the chaos of the Blitz as an opportunity to attack women.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.sub-title: The Brides In The Bath Killer
programme.desc: The case of George Smith, who married a succession of women and murdered them so he could inherit their wealth.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day explores the case of Edith Thompson, who conspired with her lover to murder her husband in 1922 - a story that inspired Alfred Hitchcock.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: A serial killer who terrorised London in 1942, using the chaos of the Blitz as an opportunity to attack women.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: General Von Klinkerhoffen, tiring of the amount of Resistance propaganda in town, decides to restart the local newspaper, and appoints Rene and Alphonse to run it.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Michelle tries to steal the Fallen Madonna from Herr Flick to boost the Resistance funds, while Edith, Yvette and Mimi are photographed for a 'Spirit of Nouvion' competition.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene decides to run for the Spanish border but is stopped before he can make it across - and General Von Klinkerhoffen gets hold of the painting. The British airmen become trapped in wine barrels in the cellar of the chateau.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: The documentary concludes with an insight into Hitler's plans to modernise the German transport system, including super trains and futuristic airports.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Meryl and Ajax compete for the seat on the council, while Penny and Jarrod are planning to elope, but who will break the news to Hugh?.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Gene learns crooked cops are going to interrupt a bullion robbery and steal the gold for themselves - a discovery that gives him the chance to root out corruption in the force once and for all. Meanwhile, the arrival of an attractive woman highlights the cracks in his relationship with Alex, who is making him doubt her trustworthiness.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Those involved in Bert's death and its subsequent cover-up search for inner peace. Sarah battles her own demons, but is aware that Colin's suffering is greater. Meanwhile, James' treatment continues to cause him suffering and Jack is determined to find answers after Carolyn's revelation. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.sub-title: A Kiss to Build a Dream On
programme.desc: Elizabeth enlists Prudence's help, and on the eve of her engagement party, Sarah confides to her aunt about a shameful secret. Meanwhile, Anna and Gino's relationship moves forward and James' treatment takes a disturbing turn. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: Wives and Daughters
programme.desc: The final episode of Andrew Davies's adaptation of Elizabeth Gaskell's comic novel, starring Justine Waddell. Victorian country doctor's daughter Molly Gibson's life is thrown into turmoil by her father's decision to remarry, and her fate becomes entwined with those of Squire Hamley, his ailing wife and their sons Osborne and Roger. Also starring Francesca Annis, Michael Gambon and Penelope Wilton.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave, Paddy, Tony and Luke plan a wild night out in Amsterdam, and Captain Keiron Voce and Kate Butler finally voice their feelings for each other.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ken Drummond's life collapses around his ears when his distraught son confesses that he has killed a prostitute, then threatens to jump to his death from a warehouse roof. Elsewhere, Samantha is haunted by the memory of her recent relationship with corrupt copper Peter Cavanaugh, who gloatingly suggests that Neil deliberately let Don Beech escape, while Gina quails at the prospect of a safari holiday with Jonathan.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gabriel is drawn deeper into his role as self-appointed avenging angel - not only does he plan to exact revenge on a woman's violent ex-boyfriend, he also blackmails Kerry into helping him mete out his own brand of justice. Elsewhere, Ken's anguish over his son's manslaughter charge threatens to hamper his attempts to negotiate the release of an abducted baby, Neil is rattled by a threatening phone call from Don Beech and Phil receives horrifying news.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Desperate to find his kidnapped daughter, Phil ignores Jack's warnings against doing anything rash and follows up a lead from an informant - only to be shot by an unseen gunman. Yvonne strikes up a friendship with a pregnant teenager and urges her to provide information about her drug-dealing boyfriend, while Kerry finally accepts Cameron's marriage proposal - but is her heart in the right place?.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Blood pouring from his gunshot wounds, Phil faces a final showdown with Weaver in an underground tunnel with only loyal Sam by his side - will they emerge victorious or fall victim to the ruthless gangster? Yvonne's efforts to help pregnant teenager Shirley are hampered by red tape, while Cameron and Kerry celebrate their engagement - blissfully unaware of a dark plan being hatched by Gabriel.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A momentous day dawns in Skelthwaite as Peggy prepares to leave her job at the health centre, while Cheryl and Dick nervously anticipate their first encounter with adopted son Oscar. Grateful of any excuse for a party, the residents are soon letting their hair down to the sound of a salsa beat.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The local rugby team goes to France for a match. Vic finds his uncle's war grave, Simon has a fling with a French businesswoman, and Anna treats a boy for epilepsy.

programme.title: Babs
programme.desc: Biopic of Barbara Windsor, following the key events of her life over the course of 50 years. The story begins in 1993, with the actress preparing for a stage performance, before flashing back to her childhood as a lonely evacuee in the Second World War, her rise to fame in the Carry On films and her difficult relationships with her father and her first husband, gangster Ronnie Knight. Samantha Spiro, Jaime Winstone and Windsor herself share the lead role.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny is concerned about a mum-to-be involved in an abusive marriage, while Trixie and Sister Evangelina find themselves in unusual circumstances on board a Swedish cargo ship looking after the captain's daughter, who is about to have her first child. Jessica Raine, Helen George, Pam Ferris and Miranda Hart star.

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: The shrewd spinster is sent to convalesce in the tropical paradise of Barbados, where she finds life decidedly dull - until a grisly double murder breaks the monotony and presents her with an unforeseen opportunity to do some serious sleuthing. Feature-length mystery, starring Joan Hickson, Donald Pleasence and Adrian Lukis.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner is reunited with a couple whose daughter was born without limbs, and takes them to a specialist unit where she can be fitted for prosthetics. However, while the experience helps the girl's mother to realise that she is not alone, it proves traumatic for the father, who blames his wife for his child's condition. Nurse Crane takes charge of Sister Winifred's driving lessons, and Trixie thinks Christopher is hiding something from her.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Kenneth Branagh stars as the world-weary Swedish detective in a fourth and final series of adaptations of Henning Mankell's novels. Wallander travels to Cape Town to investigate the disappearance of a Swedish woman. He uncovers a complex conspiracy behind the mystery, and is also confronted with a nation that has reached a turning point in its history.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Boyd is horrified to learn that Carl Mackenzie, the man accused of a shopping centre massacre, has been granted the right to appeal. Refusing to believe the wrong man was convicted, he throws himself into the case, but when the squad unearths new evidence that supports Mackenzie's claim, it also leads to the discovery of some disturbing truths about their superior officer. Trevor Eve stars.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A family from Swansea attempt to top the Tenable tower and win a big cash prize by answering top 10 list questions in the daily quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Back to Mine
programme.desc: Hotel concierge Nigel is house hunting for love with the help of his best friend Rufus. The singleton is looking to find someone special and give them the five-star treatment. To do so, Nigel visits three London-based women's homes and is faced with a tricky choice when it comes to picking one to take on a date. There is a gin-loving interior stylist, an Ibiza party girl and a former ballet dancer. Who will be heading back to his?.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: A duplicitous supervisor on board an oil rig tries to sabotage the facility's operation, and it is up to Lady Penelope and Kayo to stop it from sinking. Animated adventure, featuring the guest voice of Emilia Clarke (Game of Thrones), with Rosamund Pike and Angel Coulby.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's dare is to drive a tank blindfolded. Can he get across the course and knock down the cardboard box wall?.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A fun run gives Mr Bean the chance to take revenge on the man who stole his parking space - but he has to hire a taxi to do it. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A hungry stork moves in with Bean and starts eating him out of house and home. His solution is to return it to the wild - but first he has to teach it to fly.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz has invented a hoverboard. After a slip-up, the board ends up in the hands of Magoo, who thinks he has found a new ironing board..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: In the desert, Fizz and Weasel plan a fireworks display for Fizz. Mountain Rescuer Magoo mistakes Weasel for a skier in distress..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: In the forest, Magoo sets up camp by the rare fruit patch, giving a warm welcome to a bear that he has mistaken for a wayward hiker..

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Spy School
programme.desc: Spy-themed game show in which two friends work together to foil the plans of evil mastermind Goldfist.

programme.title: Beautiful Baking with Juliet Sear
programme.desc: The baking expert prepares a selection of dough-based items, including breakfast bagels, doughnuts and cinnamon rolls. Master baker Richard Bertinet gives a lesson in baking sourdough, transforming it into a filled pain surprise, and Juliet also visits a mill to find out how flour is produced.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner celebrate the best of coast and country cuisine. Lisa starts with a fish pie that is ready in no time before John makes roast beef and gravy - served with his wife's Yorkshire pudding. This is followed up with a classic meatloaf with a modern twist and sticky toffee pudding for dessert.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha re-creates the family feasts of China with chef Jeremy Pang. The menu comprises the street food snack jianbing for breakfast, prawn toasts with smacked cucumber for lunch, Jeremy's claypot chicken and mushroom rice for lunch and Nadia's banana fritters for dessert.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle visits Yorkshire to see how cycling has taken off in recent years, and takes part in some of the area's steepest challenges. Liz Bonnin is in Shropshire for an encounter with a wolf and actor David Bradley returns to Northumberland and Alnwick Castle, where he starred in the Harry Potter movies.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking contestants Jane, Adrian and Laura to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000

programme.title: The X Factor: Celebrity
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary hosts the star-studded version of the singing contest, in which the line-up of famous faces leave their comfort zones and take to the stage to perform - and while some have proved to be naturals, others have struggled somewhat. Simon Cowell mentors the Groups, Nicole Scherzinger is in charge of the Overs, and Louis Walsh handles the Unders, and as usual the judges are each allowed to send one act through to next week by pushing the golden buzzer, leaving the rest at the mercy of the voting public.

programme.title: Back to Mine
programme.desc: Former Butlins Redcoat Paul is house hunting for love with the help of his mum Alison. The singleton is keen to find his perfect match but is not sure whether to opt for the guy he has everything in common with or someone who appears to be his polar opposite. He has to choose from a rollerblading hairdresser, a fancy dress-wearing rugby player and a designer label-loving gymnast. Which one will Paul choose to take back to his home?.

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1 (2010)
programme.desc: The dark lord Voldemort rises to ultimate power over the magical world, so the teenage wizard and his friends set out on a mission to find the magical horcruxes - artefacts containing parts of the evil wizard's soul that hold the key to destroying him. The first half of the two-part conclusion to the fantasy saga, starring Daniel Radcliffe, Ralph Fiennes, Emma Watson and Rupert Grint.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield returns to put more Christmas gifts to the test, aided by his wife Steph, celebrity guests and members of the public. They begin by gearing up for Black Friday with tips on the best gifts and gadgets on the market. With sales of personal electric vehicles on the up, Corrie trio Jack AP Shepherd (David), Alan Halsall (Tyrone) and Colson Smith (Craig) put hoverboards and scooters to the test. Clare Balding is on a mission to find the pefect present for pets and Eddie 'the Eagle' Edwards ranks gift experiences such as track racing, skydiving and flyboarding.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: A special edition of the game show in which host Stephen Mulhern invites comedy pairings to take place. Inside No 9 stars Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, Danny John-Jules and Robert Llewellyn of Red Dwarf fame and Nina Wadia and Lynda Baron, who co-star in Still Open All Hours, are the famous duos taking part. As usual they try to guess the popular phrases in the hope of scoring enough points to win a cash prize for their charity of choice - and making it through to the Super Catchphrase to play for 50,000

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Seven days into their jungle experience, things step up a gear for the campmates as Ant and Dec gather them together for this year's live Bushtucker Trial. But who will the viewers have chosen to undertake the challenge? Plus, highlights of the past 24 hours.

programme.title: In the Line of Fire with Ross Kemp
programme.desc: The actor and film-maker follows tactical firearms units to investigate whether all police in the UK will one day be armed. With armed officers now a more regular presence on Britain's streets - in train stations and at airports - Ross goes out on a raid with a mobile undercover unit used to tackle new dangers with pre-emptive and confrontational tactics. He also gains access to their military-style training facility.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian meets Samson, an akita receiving treatment for an injured nose. Elsewhere, things are looking up for Hugo, who may have found a family to adopt him, the same family that previously adopted his brother. Paul also meets a former racing greyhound who has spent most of his time in kennels, and is ready for life in a domestic home.

programme.title: The Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Chuck Zukowski, who has been investigating phenomena across the US for 25 years, reveals a pattern he has spotted - UFOs appearing along the 37th parallel north.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini follows up leads on a Woody, a Lotus Elite and a Roadster.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini tries to make some money from a 1967 Dodge Power Wagon, and a two-cylinder Renault is auctioned.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Butch foolishly trusted his 1969 Camaro to a restoration rip-off artist, so the Fantomworks team sets out to fix the mind-boggling mistakes and give Butch the car of his dreams.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A blaze at a fireworks factory sparks a massive explosion, two pilots survive a fiery crash-landing on an aircraft carrier, and a car is driven into a restaurant.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A rocket explosion scatters bystanders who fear for their lives, six racing cars are destroyed in a crash on a wet track, and a bull rider is trampled by his animal.

programme.title: Fifth Gear

programme.title: Overhaulin'

programme.title: Pacific Warriors

programme.title: Extreme Car Hoarders

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard finds a mysterious piece of black pottery in Lancashire, locates an exotic piece in a zoo in East Anglia and fiercely haggles with an old foe in a salvage yard.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Deep in the countryside, expert restorers take in Britain's broken and battered artefacts and bring them back to life while learning the rich history of the objects.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts take on the challenges of restoring three cherished family heirlooms, bringing back to life a painting, a ceramic plaque and a Japanese lacquered jewellery box.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: The interventions of the Security and Customs Services at the borders of Spain, whose staff are under the constant threat from drugs, weapons, and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Ted Bundy: Mind of a Monster
programme.desc: First in a two-part documentary providing an insight into the mind of the serial killer, using archive footage, interviews with victims' friends and family, and the voice of Bundy himself.

programme.title: The Murder Tapes
programme.desc: Free-spirited mother Michelle Kinney had no enemies, yet when she was killed detectives unveiled a haunting truth, that led to a shocking confession from an unlikely person.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of 24-year-old Crystal Houston in the desert town of Socorro, New Mexico. She died in April 2001, 14 months after her older sister, Stephanie, was killed in a suspicious accident.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How two fugitives committed the biggest bank robbery in Wisconsin's history after escaping on their way to court.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator Racelle Carlson faces the challenge of checking on a house full of dogs. Two brothers live there, but at first they won't let anyone inside the property.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Harriet the Bearded Dragon has a worrying lump on the side of her leg that requires an urgent operation, and a sick 10-week-old puppy is put in danger by her protective owner.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Erin wants a blue dress for her wedding, but must persuade her sceptical entourage, while Kate goes in search of a unique gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Consultant Jessica has her hands full with a bride-to-be who has obsessive-compulsive disorder.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Cindy and Lamar's four children from other relationships are excited about picking a dress, while Cheyna wants to look like a princess on her big day.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Feisty meerkats are not impressed by a visit from the vet, a cat needs treatment after being mauled by two dogs, and an angry alligator is brought in for x-rays.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown must work out the best solution for a pup's badly deformed leg, a cat is brought in after being run over, and Tim and Julie are busy collecting koala dung.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Randy's food addiction cost him his marriage and access to his daughter, so he endeavours to lose weight through surgery for her sake.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: A catch-up on Melissa Morris, who lost over 500lbs and saw her weight drop to 137lbs. Now, facing marital problems and life as a single mother, she's struggling with new weight gain.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: A woman turns to behaviourist Jackson Galaxy for help controlling her vicious feline, which is posing a threat to her 95-year-old mother.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A different trio takes charge of the sales floor, but not everyone agrees that change is a good thing.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The crew meets a celebrity designer and a bride-to-be who wants a wedding dress painted on her.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: How some brides struggle to find the perfect dress, and their idea of a perfect wedding can be put in doubt.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride-to-be brings scorecards to rate her gowns, while another has her first fitting. Plus, the annual Blowout Sale begins.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman's sorority sisters surprise her with a weekend trip, but there is something fishy about their appointment. Bride-to-be Lauren tries to please her aunt.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Camille brings along her mother-in-law, in the hope of improving their relationship. Plus, consultant Keasha helps her friend to find the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: New consultant Carmel receives a tall order from her first customer of the day, while another woman wants to spend $2,000 on an elaborate red dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman refuses to stay within her budget while shopping for a dress, while Dorianne's father becomes emotional during her fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride-to-be who has planned a fairy-themed wedding hopes to find a dress to match. Plus, Vicki returns for a fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: All brides have a tight budget, forcing some to haggle for even more bang for their buck. It remains to be seen whether everyone will be able to secure their dream dress.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa decides her father's truck is such an eyesore that she is going to give it a makeover. Later, she shocks a mechanic with some amazing validations.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Larry Jr wants to host a small barbecue with his friends to break in the new back garden, but Theresa has other ideas and turns the event into a traditional Hawaiian party.

programme.title: Crikey! It's the Irwins
programme.desc: Terri, Bindi and Robert prepare Croc One, Steve Irwin's research ship, for a special mission to release an endangered sea turtle back into the wild.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: Lisa Joyner helps a man find out why his adoption was part of an illegal baby-selling scheme. A cancer survivor tasks Chris Jacobs with finding her birth mother.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.sub-title: Delroy Grant: The Hunt for the Night Stalker
programme.desc: For 17 years, a serial attacker raped elderly victims in their own homes in south London. This documentary reveals how officers caught culprit Delroy Grant who operated in the area between October 1992 and May 2009.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Relatives of serial killer Robert Maudsley reveal how his shocking crimes impacted the family. Were there any signs of his murderous intentions?.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: After three years and five surgeries, Milla is one of Dr Now's most successful patients ever. However, she needs to continue pushing through the pain to reach her final goal.
